observe.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
It was observed that 40 percent of patients had high blood pressure.
Officers observed him driving at 90 miles per hour.
observe.translation[0].definitions[0].no: In everyday English, people say that someone sees, notices, or spots something or someone:
She was spotted going into a restaurant with a well-known footballer.
observe.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to watch something or someone carefully
observe.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The police have been observing his movements.
One student performs the experiment, while his partner observes.
Observe how the people in the group interact.
observe.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to say or write what you have noticed about a situation
observe.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Keynes observed that humans fall into two classes.
observe.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to do what you are supposed to do according to a law or agreement
observe.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: So far the ceasefire has been observed by both sides.
observe.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to do things and obey laws that are part of a religion or custom
